page.title: 09A CHEESE FIT FOR A QUEEN
page.content: Cheese making has long been a feature of life in West Pennard. On 28 June 1839 a very special cheese was made from the milk of 737 cows and was to be presented to Queen Victoria from the villagers. After long preparation, hard work and much celebration a giant cheese of half a ton was presented to the Queen in February 1841. Sadly,Her Majesty preferred old cheese and the cheese returned to West Pennard to be kept in an iron cage for its safety. The farmers were so proud of their cheese that it was exhibited in the towns of Somerset. Alas,no-one noticed the deterioration of the cheese and it became so bad that it could not, after all, be presented to the Queen. A similar although more modest project was planned in 1977 when a 60lb cheese was made to celebrate the Silver Jubilee of Queen Elizabeth II.
